summary: This document is an email chain forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, containing a tip from Patrick Disanto regarding alleged 'sponsorship' public service announcements (PSAs) embedded in film scripts about victims connected to Jeffrey Epstein and other predators. The email describes the content of the scripts, the harassment faced by a film producer, and seeks advice on presenting the information to authorities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a predator directly connected to a young female victim mentioned in the email. His case is the subject of the tip being forwarded.

persons.name: Patrick Disanto
persons.context: Author of the initial email tip. He describes writing film scripts containing PSAs about victims of predators, claims to have been harassed and assaulted, and had his children removed from his custody.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The email suggests presenting the information to him as he is 'covering the subject currently - most intimately Jeff Epstein'.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having the described film scripts on his desk in lower Manhattan.

persons.name: Martin Jacobsen
persons.context: A soccer coach at Martin Luther King HS, subject of the first film 'JAKE' which included a PSA about an Epstein victim.

persons.name: Matt MacKlee
persons.context: Character portrayed by Patrick Disanto in the film '35 cents'.

persons.name: M. Jim Jenkins
persons.context: Listed as an attorney representing Patrick Disanto, located in Pensacola, Florida.

persons.name: Sylvia Penner
persons.context: Listed as an attorney from the firm Fleeson, Gooing, Coulson & Kitch, LLC, presumably involved in representation.

persons.name: Klein
persons.context: Listed among predators such as Epstein, Weinstein, Cooper, and Mandlebaum that victims came into contact with.

persons.name: Cooper
persons.context: Listed among predators such as Epstein, Weinstein, Klein, and Mandlebaum that victims came into contact with.

persons.name: Mandlebaum
persons.context: Listed among predators such as Epstein, Weinstein, Klein, and Cooper that victims came into contact with.

persons.name: Stein
persons.context: Mentioned in parentheses regarding the record of Patrick Disanto's care for his children.

connections.description: Disanto is providing a tip to authorities about film content related to an Epstein victim.
Disanto's film scripts were reportedly on Weinstein's desk.
Jenkins is listed as an attorney representing Disanto.
Penner is listed as an attorney from a firm representing Disanto.
Both are grouped together as named predators in the context of the email.

events.title: Production of film 'JAKE'
events.description: A sports film about coach Martin Jacobsen was produced, containing a PSA about a young female victim of 'sponsorship' because direct attention could not be drawn to her situation at the time.

events.title: Harassment and assault of Patrick Disanto
events.description: Patrick Disanto, while portraying a character in the film '35 cents', was reportedly harassed by officials, had his children removed from custody, and was later assaulted, shutting down production.

events.title: Tip forwarded to SDNY
events.description: An email tip from Patrick Disanto regarding Epstein-connected film content was forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The email describes film scripts containing 'sponsorship' PSAs about victims, including a 13-year-old female victim connected to Jeffrey Epstein, which were reportedly on Harvey Weinstein's desk.
Patrick Disanto claims he faced severe harassment, including having his children removed from his custody and being assaulted, for his involvement in producing films about these topics.
The tip alleges that victims were 'sponsored' by a Canadian official and an American official, which is described as 'disturbing in itself'.
The email is being forwarded as part of the U.S. Attorney's Office's practice of conveying tips related to the Epstein case, indicating an active intake process for information.
